Despite being outmatched and physically thrown, continues to tread water and consider the situation rationally.
Says 'good always wins over bad, especially wit' me Poppa, ma girl, an' me chilt in me corner,' showing his loyalty and love for family.
Engages in violent fight with Bluto, tearing apart the deck and using everything in sight as weapons.
Continuing to fight Bluto despite the danger, showing persistence and resilience.
No explicit friendly or sincere interaction; focused on the fight and survival.
Ducks the treasure chest thrown by Bluto, avoiding harming others in the vicinity such as the Tax-Man.
Slugs Bluto aggressively, which leads to Bluto collapsing into the sea.
Floats calmly with Olive and Sweepea on flotsam, feet in the water, relaxed and seemingly sharing peaceful time.
Tells Olive that a woman and family cannot come to sea with him, showing disapproval of Olive's wishes.
Slugs Bluto effectively, causing him to fall into the sea.
Floats calmly on flotsam with Olive and Sweepea after the houseboat sinks, indicating presence of mind.
Refuses to allow Olive and Sweepea to come to sea, citing his identity as a sailor and sailors can't take families to sea.
Glowers and disapproves of Olive's declaration of independence, showing inflexibility.
His family of friends, including traditional adversary Bluto, is linked together and drags along in his wake, indicating inclusive leadership and acceptance.
Olive and Popeye shyly hold hands and she rests her head on his shoulder, showing a sincere and tender connection.
Coordinates and anchors a complex formation of his friends and rivals physically linked by ship's rigging while foot-paddling home, demonstrating leadership and control.
Displays affectionate and shy behavior with Olive, holding hands and allowing vulnerability, indicating emotional awareness rather than a direct indicator of competence.
